title: Leech Prevention and Safe Removal
brief: Prevent leech attachment and safely remove leeches without causing injury.
steps: Step 1: Tuck trouser legs into boots when traveling through leech habitats.
Step 2: Check body frequently for leeches, especially after water crossings.
Step 3: To remove attached leech, use fingernail or tool to break suction at narrow end.
Step 4: Work tool around leech's mouth to release grip completely.
Step 5: Clean wound area thoroughly after removal.
Step 6: Apply pressure to control bleeding from anticoagulant effects.
warnings: Never pull leech off forcefully - mouth parts may remain embedded.
Swallowed leeches can attach inside throat or nose causing severe infections.
Always treat water from questionable sources to kill leeches.
Avoid camping directly in swampy areas when possible.
